column4: i have a problem with xine and mkv. when playing mkv files, the sound is skipping. anyone experiences this too?
i want to know if anyone experiences my problem too... btw, i don't like the interface of vlc... it's a matter of taste...
i havent experienced that in xine but vlc has choppy video
what is your xine-lib version? so you can play mkv files smoothly with xine, huh?
couldnt find xine-lib in synaptic but i found others and they are 1.1.7
im viewing LOST S04E01 and there is no sign of choppiness in audio or video like in vlc
how do i stop ubuntu from starting in low graphics mode?

in ubuntu, xine-lib is libxine... same here 1.1.7... so your mkv files play smoothly, huh? i'm viewing gundam 00 mkv (h264+aac) and patlabor mkv (xvid+mp3). the sound is skipping, especially in opening and closing song...
mine only chops once at the start of the movie between 00:01 and 00:08 and thats it, no more skips after that thats not a prob to me though
i see... so it's just me... strange... ok, thank you anyway. for now i will just avoid mkv files....
mine only chops once at the start of the movie between 00:01 and 00:08 and thats it, no more skips after that thats not a prob to me though
how do i stop ubuntu from starting in low graphics mode??
it's ok. besides mkv is relatively new, right? i just have to be patient... i still have a lot if time...
its the first time ive heard of .mkv after downloading that LOST ep
yeah, it is really new and its advantages is it can store any video and audio format + subtitle. i heard that ibm has bought it. um... i think it's getting off topic...
